name: Sunset Inn and Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stay at the Sunset frequently. It is an apartment style hotel with each suite having kitchen and dining facilities, as well most suite have a small balcony which offers nice views over False Creek, and English Bay.
reviews.title: Great Location and Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: we have found the suites universally clean, quiet, well stocked or meal preparation
reviews.title: Great location, very nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The front desk people are friendly, helpful, knowledgaebale about the immedoiate area restaurants, and other local Vancouver attractions.
reviews.title: Great post cruise stay at the Sunset Inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: It is easy an easy, pleasnt 10 minute walk to downtown Vancouver
reviews.title: Good Value for Vancouver and Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: in the neighbourhood around the Sunset are a wonderful selection of good restaurants, offering a wide variety of foods
reviews.title: Incredible customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Spent 2 nights after Alska cruise. Reserved 1 bedroom "executive suite" with balcony on higher floor - referred to as "best room in the house" by desk clerk. It probably was. Huge room with wonderful king bed and 2 sofa beds - which were actually sleepable. Full kitchen with dinnerware. Balcony with incredible city views. Beautiful bathroom. Very clean. Price was also good. Location, while out of main downtown area, was walkable to that area and since Vancouver is full of high-rise everything, a pleasant break. One of the nicest places of this type I have seen.
reviews.title: Great rooms, bad customer service
This kept getting worse and worse
reviews.text: Now, the problem. Told at check-in that of the 2 elevators, one was inoperable since it was being over-hauled. Therefore, elevator service would be slow. Fine. Shortly after check-in, remaining elevator ceased to function for 6 hours and then worked intermittently for next 6. Little info provided by desk other than to say that it was because "Russians were fixing it" - what in the world does that mean?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walked up 9 floors, did not go out to dinner because of elevator issue. Husband inquired as to possibility of moving next day if there still was an elevator problem. Assured we could and to check in AM. Next thing we knew, we were evicted in AM from our glorious room and forced into 2 regular second floor rooms and promised they would "do something about the rate". No amount of arguing that we wanted to stay (since by then elevator appeared to be working) helped. They stated they had "sold our room". I suggested they unsell it or put new guests in 2 second floor rooms for 1 night. They refused. Nor did they even offer to help us move our stuff.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: Upon check-out there was no rate adjustment and since it was at 5:30 AM, no one with power to change it was present. Placed note to management with unsigned bill and awaiting response.
reviews.title: May 2008

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here due to all the great reviews on Tripadvisor.Let me tell you that all the reviews seem very skewed and do not at all reflect the experience I had. I doubt I am alone, as the negatives were "built-in" to the experience and not on a personal basis.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sunset Inn and Suites is the best value-for-money I have come across in a long time. Our one-bedroom executive (i.e. higher floor) suite was $129/night. For that, we got a one-bedroom furnished apartment. There were sufficient pots and pans, plates and bowls, etc. that we could have made all our meals there. But why do that when they are loads of restaurants on Davie St., just one block away? The living/dining area was quite large but the bedroom was a little tight on space. Everything was spotlessly clean and the furniture appeared to me to be of good quality and pretty new. The sofa in the living room was a sofabed, so 4 people could conceivably have stayed in the apartment. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We recently had a family long weekend in Vancouver and stayed at the Sunset Inn and Suites. We chose this hotel primarily as it has suites suitable for a family of 5. What we found was a quite reasonably priced, comfortable accommodation for the 5 of us in a great downtown location for exploring Vancouver.
reviews.title: Family Suites - Vancouver, BC

likes.disliked: — The couch and wireless internet issues.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: We had only a couple of minor issues, one being that one of the sofa-beds had a damaged mechanism, making it "almost" impossible to open, and, that their free wireless internet access is not compatible with Safari on Mac. :-( The suite included two sofa-beds, a separate room with a king & TV, a 32" LCD TV in the living area, views of Granville Island, a dining table, desk and a suitably appointed kitchen.
reviews.title: The Sunset Inn is outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Sunset Inn recently.
reviews.title: Great for self-sufficient travellers

likes.liked: — Suits independent travellers. Comfortable, car parking, laundry.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's location is outstanding - a block away from restaurants and, for your full -working kitchen, supermarkets.
reviews.title: Great location,very comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights. We had a suite at the back of the hotel, so the view was ok, overlooking a street and the back of the shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great hotel & location for Stanley Park area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: The room was large, with a well equipped kitchen. The only strange thing that we had not come across before was that breakfast was self service from a area in the corridor between the reception and the lifts, and taken back to the room.
reviews.title: Great location n friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and we found the staff very helpful, even giving us discount vouchers, to the suspension bridge.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel - Nice people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One way to see Stanley Park is to rent a cycle from one of the many outlets around the area. This was a great way to see the park and some of the water front.
reviews.title: Good location but only just ok for the cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we ever visit Vancouver again we would book this Hotel without any hesitation.
reviews.title: Great location and customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: A hotel can make or break your vacation. Sunset Inn and Suites exceeded all expectations of a hotel stay. The suites became a home with all the luxuries of home. It was comfortable, clean and spacious. It is located in Davie Village filled with excellent restaurants, farmer's markets and close to the English Bay. To save the best for last, the staff was exceptional. They were not just friendly, they were personable, knowledgable and spent that extra time to make you feel at home. Arabella, Elvis and Dave spent time giving us local tips/help on attractions, restaurants and transportation which made our vacation better than any trip I could plan using a travel book or website. I will be forever grateful to them.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property was centrally located, clean, quite with front desk personnel and housekeeping staff that were pleasant and really wanted to please you. We stayed on the 10th floor with views of the mountains and the city skyline. The beds were comfortable and the morning buffet was just OK, but free.
reviews.title: Super Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights after our land/cruise tour. Even though we arrived early in the morning, our room was ready. If I could have given a 4 1/2 rating, I would have. Like others have said, the hotel is on a quiet residential street but very close to Davie street, which has all the restaurants and shops that you might need during your stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The furniture was a little dated, especially our sofa. The cushions were collapsed and slanted and it was uncomfortable to sit on it. Everything was clean and the suite was large. We stayed in room 1002.
reviews.title: Great location
Very good place to stay
reviews.text: Everyone at the front desk were friendly and helpful with taxis and restaurant suggestions. Elvis checked us in and suggested 5 different restaurants. We made it to 3 of them and they were all excellent. The staff definitely knows the area and will not steer you wrong with their suggestions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sunset Inn & Suites is a great hotel! Friendly and helpful staff, large and exceptionally spacious rooms with nice views. We arrived very late (1:30am) and had called ahead to alert them; the front desk staff was so polite and helpful - they even still had a parking space available for us! The free parking is a huge perk in Vancouver and if you want to take the double-decker bus tour, it's just around the corner. We walked everywhere without any problems. There was a slight error on our bill when we checked out (a mess-up on the booking through an agency - not the hotel's fault) and they immediately corrected it. We were just sorry that we couldn't stay longer...but we will be back!
reviews.title: Great hotel in a perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a great property for our family of four. After traveling up the Northwest coast on vacation we were tired of the small hotel rooms in each city we visited so this was a perfect last stop for us. The room is an apartment versus hotel room off the main road but only one block to great food, transportation including hop on hop off buses and two blocks to English Bay and waterfront. Very convenient. Desk staff very friendly and helpful. Great sunset views from upper level patio of bay and water. Free parking for our vehicle icing on the cake. On top rate for room very competitive. Only issue was rushing children past a few interesting store fronts and bars on Davie St but were not any issue at all.
reviews.title: Great Big room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked from UK due to previous reviews and wasn't disappointed. A view of Granville Bridge and a glimpse of water, mountain snippets and city to the rear - great facilities and free Wi-fi (11.05Mbps download 4.90Mbps upload - speedtest.net result from my phone). The breakfast was actually a little more than we'd expected and was topped up by fresh fruit direct from Granville Island Farmers Market. The Market is just a minutes walk and a tiny ferry ride away. We both loved the area and location. Facilities were great and can't fault the staff - young lady on reception was especially awesome. So nice to come back to an amartment instead of a overpriced underequipped compact hotel room. We certainly realised this once we moved on to Toronto - bought breakfast AND no bowls, spoons etc.
reviews.title: Just like coming home...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: Wish I'd stayed here the first time I was in Vancouver. Vibrant Davie St. community just round the corner (some great drag queens about) and so many restaurant, food shops, take aways etc close by. You can comfortably walk from here, around English Bay to Stanley Park, explore the park a bit, come back via Coal Harbour and still only walk about 9 miles.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay for Canucks Game!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll certainly be avoiding hotels in the future now Sunset Inn has opened my eyes to the joys of an apartment whilst on hols. Thanks guys - an awesome time in Vancouver!
reviews.title: Ideal location and great suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: First, the pluses... the general location is OK, relatively close to downtown Vancouver, a few blocks from False Creek and the Grandville Isle ferry (good) one block from Davie Street (NOT GOOD). The interior of our room was nice and relatively new. The sofa bed is not fit for humans.
reviews.title: Sun is setting on the Sunset Inn
Pretty underwhelmed with the service
reviews.text: The problems: We were assigned the "Dumpster view suite". Look out the window,,,see an open dumpster. Actually the dumpster was not the worst part of the view, it was the piles of trash surrounding the dumpster. The front desk person suggested that we "close the drapes" and stay out of the room until after dark. Thanks. The front desk person indicated we could move to a better location for a an upgrade charge, but when I came downstairs to complete the transaction for the move the offer was rescinded as no "better" room was available. Not sure how other reviewers of this hotel on this website got a free upgrade.

reviews.title: Great Location-Large area to hang out in
reviews.text: The front desk people were among the worst I have interacted with in 36 years of travel. They were aloof, unfriendly and seemed bothered by the simplest question about the area or "how do you get to X?" questions. While air conditioning is listed as one of the "amenities" of the Sunset Inn, in fact there is only one cranky window unit in the bedroom and nothing in the living area. When I called the front desk about the living room being hot they indicated that AC really shouldn't be necessary and if the room was too hot it was due to "global warming". Thanks guys.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The maid service was marginal. The maid apparently never entered the kitchen area of the suite and didn't respond to requests for soap, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent

likes.liked: — It's location - so close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: There are plenty of great hotels in Vancouver. I would avoid this hotel at all costs. The 2 stars rating is an extreme exaggeration.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat this. This small hotel has 50 suites on 11 floors, each with real balconies, either overlooking English Bay or the cityscape and mountains, all in a great location.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was terrific. We booked one of the "executive suites". Nice large bedroom with king size bed, desk and desk chair. Dining room area with 4 ft diameter table and four chairs and a kitchen with full fridge, oven, microwave, coffee percolator, electric tea kettle, teapot, cutlery, pots and pans, etc. In other words, fully equipped.
reviews.title: Very Dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bathroom was small but, heh, what do you want to do in a bathroom?
reviews.title: Nice Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was very clean. I particularly liked the hardwood floors in bedroom and dining area. Would have been nice to have a sitting chair in the bedroom area (our suite was totally open - except bathroom). But no real loss since we spent lots of time reading on the balcony.
reviews.title: An excellent choice

likes.disliked: — Having to take breakfast to the suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: Nice staff and did I mention the location? On the edge of downtown in an apartment area. Two blocks from a beach and aqua taxi to Granville Island (don't miss the farmers' market there), 8 blocks to English Bay beach and Stanley Park. we walked a lot. 5 minutes to downtown. 10 minutes to Chinatown or Gastown. 15 minutes to Stanley Park. One block away is Davie Street with, I'm guessing, 30 or 40 restaurants and bakeries. Every cuisine style, all casual. Would you belive a Transylvanian bakery, just one block from hotel, as was a convenience store. Two more blocks away and you've got two fine vegetable and fruit stores.
reviews.title: Great Vancouver hotel!

description: Welcome to our family-owned Sunset Inn & Suites hotel in Vancouver located on a quiet, tree-lined residential street in the charming West End. Our residential-style Vancouver suites offer all the comforts of home with separate bedrooms, living rooms, fully-equipped kitchens, dining areas and private balconies. Whether your Vancouver travels are for leisure or business, our spacious suites at affordable rates are ideal for memorable family vacations, productive business trips and extended stays in Vancouver. Find numerous amenities at our Vancouver hotel including free gated parking, wireless Internet and breakfast. Then explore the endless Vancouver attractions within walking distance including the English Bay, Robson Street, and more. Our friendly staff looks forward to going above and beyond to make your stay at our Vancouver hotel unforgettable.
